questions.text: Where is it prohibited to make a U-turn?

answers.text: On pedestrian road
On railway crossroad
In tunnel, on bridge, underpass, overpass, narrow places
On a large, empty parking lot

questions.text: When is a U-turn prohibited due to visibility?

answers.text: When visibility is reduced under 50 meters
In limited visibility
During a heavy fog on a mountain road
On a sunny day with full visibility
On a railway crossroad without a barrier
On pedestrian road
At crossroads of equivalent roads
On a highway with two lanes in each direction

questions.text: Why can overtaking be dangerous in limited visibility?

answers.text: You may not see oncoming traffic
Itâ€™s harder to judge safe distance and speed
You could endanger others without time to react
Your car automatically speeds up

questions.text: What makes overtaking illegal regarding lane use?

answers.text: Using the lane of counter movement and being unable to return safely
Driving completely in the opposite lane with oncoming traffic
Trying to overtake near a bend with limited sight
Overtaking a slow vehicle on a clear, straight road

questions.text: Where is parking and staying NOT allowed?

answers.text: On a marked parking spot with no signage
After a pedestrian road
Five meters before and after a cross road
In a cross road

questions.text: Where is parking and staying NOT allowed?

answers.text: Where the vehicle obstructs or limits the visibility of signs
When less than 3 meters from an uninterrupted line
Five meters before a pedestrian road and on a pedestrian road

questions.text: Where is parking and staying allowed?

answers.text: Where the vehicle obstructs or limits the visibility of signs
After a pedestrian road
Five meters before a pedestrian road and on a pedestrian road

questions.text: What do the road signs B24 and B25 indicate?

answers.text: Prohibition of overtaking
You must not park or stay immediately after these signs
They allow overtaking of emergency vehicles

questions.text: What does this road sign indicate?

answers.text: Prohibition of both parking and staying
Only stopping is prohibited
Parking is allowed for up to 5 minutes

questions.text: What does this road sign indicate?

answers.text: Only parking is prohibited, but stopping temporarily is allowed
No entry for any vehicles
Loading and unloading is prohibited

questions.text: Which of the following are prohibited on a highway?

answers.text: Staying, parking, or driving in the emergency lane
Driving backward or making U-turns
Entering while towing with a rope or flexible connection
Driving with lights on during the day
